Is the advertising duopoly cracking? üìâ
In 2019, Google and Meta controlled over 50% of the US online ads market. Today that dominance is eroding.

 

Who is taking their place?
Mostly Amazon.
But also TikTok, Walmart, Pinterest, streaming giants like Netflix.

 

And... Spotify, Reddit, Snap, the list goes on.

 

ChatGPT ads will soon join the ranks too.

 

As if AI wasn't disrupting marketing enough, now we have to juggle extreme media fragmentation.

 

And this is a new reality for "young" marketers like me (<40 üòÖ).

 

My media budget spreadsheet went from just a few rows in 2016 to thousands of lines in 2025. No joke!

 

Trying to do marketing today like we did 10 years ago isn't just outdated.
It is insanity!

 

But what does this fragmentation mean in practice?

 

1. Specialisation is not enough.
Brands cannot afford to hire just a "Google Ads Specialist." They need marketers who can navigate every platform, because a new one might pop up tomorrow. The era of the full-stack marketer is here!

 

2. Measurement is a war zone.
Which ad network is delivering the best ROI? Good luck answering that!

 

3. Streamline streamline.
The most valuable assets will be SaaS tools or agencies that enable a bird's-eye view of media buying across all channels. So far I haven't found any, but I'm sure they'll come.

 

We are in the midst of a whole new marketing revolution.
Better getting ready now!
